title: I contributed to a bill for Rs. 50,000. What is the difference between a discount of 25% to that of two successive discounts of 20% and 10%? - Quora

response.answer_text: While I get a straightaway discount of 25% , I am paying 75% of the bill . But I when I get a 20% discount first , then I am paying 80% of the bill . A further discount of 10% , then I pay 80–8= 72% of the bill . So I am paying 75–72=3 percents less or 500x3= 1500₹ less with successive discounts //

If a discount of 25% is provided to you for a bill amount of Rs. 50000, your spend from your pocket will be Rs. 37500; Discount will be = 12500                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              On the other hand, if a discount of 20% and 10% are applied successively to the bill, your spend will be 80/100*50k*90/100=0.72*50k=Rs.36000; Discount=14000;                                                                                                           So, applying 2 successive discounts yields better results compared to your one-shot discount, in your problem statement.
